body:
This is a general question that confuse me:

I have only one compiler, gcc 4.4.6 installed,  I would like to install a package, let's call it P

Why `spack install P%gcc@4.4` and `spack install P%gcc@4.4.6` install the same package twice at two different locations, using the same compiler?

What is the purpose of this behavior? I expect spack automatically complete the compiler version if it is unique or report if it is ambiguous.
title: compiler version in spec
